summary: In this context, 1,2,4-trimethylbenzene and glycol are both categorized as volatile organic compounds (VOCs) contributing to the global VOC score, which quantifies air pollutants in dwellings. While they are included in separate classifications of VOCs (aromatic hydrocarbons for 1,2,4-trimethylbenzene and glycol ethers for glycol), there is no direct interaction or specific relationship discussed between them beyond their classification as air pollutants.
